com.mygdx.pirategame

Class PirateGame

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.badlogic.gdx.Game
      • com.mygdx.pirategame.PirateGame
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    com.badlogic.gdx.ApplicationListener

    public class PirateGame
extends com.badlogic.gdx.Game
    The start of the program. Sets up the main backbone of the game. This includes most constants used for collision and changing screens Provides access for screens to interact with each other and the options interface

    • Method Detail

      • create

        public void create()
        Creates the main body of the game. Establishes the batch for the whole game as well as sets the first screen Also sets up audio interface

      • changeDifficulty

        public void changeDifficulty(float difficulty)
        Change the difficulty of the game
        Parameters:
        difficulty - the difficulty of the game

      • changeScreen

        public void changeScreen(int screen)
        Changes the screen without killing the prior screen. Allows for the screens to be returned to without making new ones
        Parameters:
        screen - the number of the screen that the user wants to swap to

      • changeScreen

        public void changeScreen(GameScreen screen)

      • getScaledLocation

        public static com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 getScaledLocation(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 point,
                                                              com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.OrthographicCamera camera)
        Used to scale a location on the screen to a location within game coordinates
        Parameters:
        point - The point on the screen
        camera - The camera that is in charge of scaling
        Returns:
        The point translated into in-game coordinates

      • getScaledMouseLocation

        public static com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 getScaledMouseLocation(com.badlogic.gdx.graphics.OrthographicCamera camera)
        Used to get the in game coordinates of the mouse
        Parameters:
        camera - The camera that is in charge of scaling
        Returns:
        The location of the mouse pointer in in-game coordinates

      • getPreferences

        public audioControls getPreferences()
        Allows the user to interact with the audio options
        Returns:
        the options object

      • resetValues

        public void resetValues()
        Resets game values to default, used on game restart

        public void killGame()
        Kills the game screen and skill tree, so they can be refreshed on next game start
